column4: that's equivalent to pulling the HD out, plugging it into another machine and expecting that machine to ask for your password before it lets you into the files
cos this apt has super cow powers
just click on him
i did and he left lol
killall gnome-panel will get rid of him
your panel will return automatically, worry not
yeah i read that on a forum but i thought my panel would not come back so i was looking for another way :P
https://launchpad.net/~kow/+archive/ppa
that ppa has a fixed vlc in it
wow cool, thanks
is it beta or something, that's why it's not released on ubuntus repo?
no promises on its stability, I think he just reverted some of the changes canonical made to the upstream source (so it's not as integrated at the expense of video in on one window)
what's kow?
kow is the guy's username
LordKow  on network irc.freenode.net if you want to talk to him
nah just wondering
so how would i install it after adding the key and to sources list i mean first i would remove the vlc i have now but then to install
after adding the repo, it will appear as an update to vlc, so just do the update
ohh ok cool just update, so when a new version appears on the default ubuntu ones i would just update again right?
yep
his versions are designed to be 'between' official releases

ok yeah i got what u mean now, but let's say i wnated to update first i would run sudo apt-get update, but then let's say i wanted to install updates without using update manager what command would i run?
upgrade :)
ok, works now :D thanks
